subject: Law
title: Brown v. Board of Education
description: One-minute skill: Brown v. Board of Education.

hook.text: Linda Brown had to walk past a white school to reach her 'colored' school miles away. Her father sued.

buildup.text: Since 1896, Plessy v. Ferguson had allowed 'separate but equal' facilities for Black and white Americans.

discovery.text: In 1954, the Supreme Court unanimously ruled: separate educational facilities are inherently unequal.

twist.text: The ruling didn't end segregation overnight. Many states resisted for years, requiring federal enforcement.

climax.text: Brown became the legal foundation for the entire civil rights movement that followed.

punchline.text: One family's lawsuit changed a nation's conscience.

quiz.question: What doctrine did Brown v. Board of Education overturn?
